intro: Loeflingia hispanica subsp. pentandra, commonly known as the Spanish bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade conditions. It is often found in rocky or limestone-rich habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
